meanings.definition: To go from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: I move quickly to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: She likes to move slowly when exploring new places.
meanings.sent3: The snail decided to move at a faster pace today.
meanings.sent4: Her words were so powerful that they could move mountains.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's graceful move captivated the audience.

meanings.sent1: Please move your chair closer to the table.
meanings.sent2: The sunflower moves to face the sun throughout the day.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to move the heavy box but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The chess player's move surprised his opponent.
meanings.sent5: The wind can move the leaves gently in the breeze.

meanings.definition: To cause to change position or location.
meanings.sent1: Can you move the vase to the center of the table?
meanings.sent2: The earthquake moved the entire city's buildings.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to move objects with his mind.
meanings.sent4: His speech really moved the audience emotionally.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's encouragement moved the student to work harder.

meanings.definition: An act of changing physical location or position.
meanings.sent1: His move to a new city brought many opportunities.
meanings.sent2: The chess player's move surprised everyone watching.
meanings.sent3: The cat's move to the top of the tree was quite daring.
meanings.sent4: The company's strategic move led to increased profits.
meanings.sent5: The quarterback's move was crucial for winning the game.
